Method Detail

createAppletWidget

public static com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget createAppletWidget(Applet applet)
Constructs an HTML element which contains an applet tag. The HTML specification states that the applet tag is deprecated. But the browser support for the object and embed tag is currently inconsistent. So using the applet tag is the only consistent way to deploy a Java Applet across browsers on all platforms.

Parameters:
applet - The Applet to take the information from.
Returns:
An HTML element which contains an applet tag.

createAppletWidget

public static com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget createAppletWidget(Applet applet,
                                                                      java.lang.String forceJavaVersion)

registerAppletCallback

public static void registerAppletCallback(Applet applet,
                                          AppletCallback appletCallback)
Registers an instance of your AppletCallback implementation to listen for callbacks coming from the given Applet. The actual Applet implementation can check whether an AppletCallback handler is installed, if so it can notify the given AppletCallback instance about updates or events. Example: First, register a listening AppletCallback object: AppletJSUtil.registerAppletCallback(stopWatchApplet, new StopWatchCallback(panelLaps)); Then callback to GWT from your Applet implementation (Java): AppletUtil.callback(StopWatchAppletImpl.this, _swLabel.getText());

Parameters:
applet - - The Applet instance to listen to.
appletCallback - - The AppletCallback instance to notify once a callback is coming.

call

public static void call(Applet applet,
                        java.lang.String methodName)
Calls the method with the given name on the Applet instance.

Parameters:
applet - - The Applet instance to call the method on.
methodName - - The name of the method to call.

args - - The method arguments.
